text: The best non-alchocoloc beer drunk so far. Quite much as a decent wheat beer
Yellow with medium white head. Bit dusty grain aroma. Medium bitterness with remarkable citrus sourness.
0,3l bottle. Nose: dried mango, pineapple, floral. Taste: lemony, grassy, floral, mango, slightly metallic. Great non/low alcoholic beer, but only good when fresh!

Bottle from systembolaget. Certainly one of the best, if not the best, alcohol free beer Ive ever had. Of course you still get that Kind of lifeless accompaniment to hops which produces a slightly lame taste and smell but overall its pretty decent, slightly sweet, hoppy. If only it didnt cost as much as normal beer Id be on it a lot more!!
Sjældent at en øl næsten uden alkohol smager af noget, men her det lykkedes.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Bardzo wytrawne, puste, wodniste, z zalegającą goryczką.

Aroma of fresh citrus. A basis of wort is present. Hazy yellow liquid with a white head. Medium sweetness and bitterness. Average carbonation and medium-full body. A great low alcohol beer - one of the best I have tried.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Pours hazy yellow with white head. Aroma of tropical fruit, grass and grain. Watery taste with some tropical fruit, orange peel and a bit of grass. Bitter finish with notes of old chewing gum.

Bright and hazy appearance, almost two finger white head.
Aroma: Citrus, melon, wheat, malt
Taste: tangerine, malt, little dusty, hint of grapefruit, little watery
bottle. low alcohol beers like gluten free are the future for most of loyal drinkers
Bottle from systembolaget. Pours a light golden colour beer with a medium head. Citrusy banan with malts and yeast. Dry sweet finish

[330 ml. bottle sampled][BBF 04/02/18] 0.3 % Version, appears to be fresh bottle especially given BBF date. Clear golden, patchy white bubbles. Nose is raw hop oil, green too raw hop, low tea, far too raw green hop oil for me. Taste is green hop oil, too much for me, overly green hop oil, tea, oil, raw overly green hop affair for me,... Body is light, lightly sparkling, hop & almost mineral. Overly aggressive green wet hop affair for me, I can see this really appealing to hop heads looking for a low ABV beer. I liked the 2 other versions that I have had a lot more.

bottle. Hazy yellow, high white bubble head. Aroma: lemon, passion fruit, resins, zest. Taste: citrus, light sour fruits, yeast, orange peel. Light body, soft carbonation, watery texture. Decent bitterness, bit strange aftertaste. Enjoyed

Bottled (from Lumo, Rauma). Hazy yellowish golden colour with a small creamy head. Aroma is mild grains, some bready and mild banaish and floral notes. Flavour is rubbery, some fruitiness along with some slight cardboardy notes.
33 cl. bottle. Hazy yellow colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, hops, citrus, grass and a mild bitterness.
Bottle. Cloudy yellow colour with small head off. Aroma of hops,malts. Taste is hoppy, grass, lightly bitter, medium sourness, medium sweetness. soft carbonation.

Color amarillo pajizo, medianamente turbio, con capa de espuma blanca de un dedo de grosor (buena retención). Carbonatación media tirando a baja. Aroma a cítricos que tira patrás. Sabor de cerveza con limón (bien calibrado), con un toque de amargor mínimo al final. Perfectamente carbonatada, en contra de lo que otros dicen. No la voy a poner por las nubes, pero para ser una cerveza de 0,3%... es más que decente. Podría beberla en muchas ocasiones sin problema.
Pale yellow opaque color with a thin foam layer. Smells like wet malt. The taste is aggressive harsh and tart, as well as bitter acidic and overcarbonated with some malt. Dry aftertaste.

Cloudy yellow body with a creamy, white head that sticks to the glass. Sweet and strong fruity aroma including tropical fruits and citrus, and minerals. Pale malts in the back, and the regular no-alcohol worty notes are pretty faint. Moderate flavour of citrus, especially lemon, some generic fruity notes and in the back I find spices and wort. Light to moderate sweet taste with a moderate to light bitter finish. Medium to light body with a rather watery texture. A bit undefinable and unfocused brew, but fair enough. 
[33 cl bottle enjoyed 15 months before BB date, from Systembolaget Kungshamn, Sweden]
Hazy yellow color with white head. Aroma of tropical fruits and grapefruits with hops. Crispy sweet fruity taste with pine and hops. Good carbonation. Very good low alcohol beer.

Samea kullankeltainen olut valkoisella, reilulla mutta aika nopeasti häipyvällä vaahdolla. Pieni kerros vaahtoa jää oluen pinnalle ja jättää myös aavistuksen pitsiä jälkeensä. Tuoksu on kevyt, greippinen ja sitruksinen. Maku pääasiassa sitruksinen ja appelsiininen sekä greippinen. Jälkimaku varsin humalaisen katkera. Pienistä prosenteista on taiottu aika kiva kokonaisuus, vaikka tietysti laajempi makukirjo ja täyteläisempi kokonaisote ei haittaisi yhtään.

Bottle from Cork & Cask. Hazy pale golden body with a thick white head. Good lacing. Aroma of plastic, bread and banana. Flavour of cucumber and mango. Medium body with. Frothy mouthfeel. Soft fizz. Quite odd but I liked it.
Bottle at home. Light, sweet wheaty, malty, slightly fruity. Doesnt taste watery at all.

Bottle
Pale yellow, white head.
Aroma of fresh lemon, sweet citrus. 
Taste bitter, old, watery hint of sweetness.

Hazy yellow beer with nice everlasting head on top. Lots of hoppy sweet fruits and grapefruit in the aroma. Taste is quite sweet at first, fresh tropical fruits and then some bitter grapefruit and citrus. Light body and high carbonation makes this a pleasure to drink. Very good low alcohol beer for a hop head.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ården with Helle. Citrus peach floral notes. Some bitterness. More dry thai sweet. Light body. Probably the best light beer in the world:)

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. A blessing among non alcochol beers. Wheat, grust, light fruity. Tropical fruit and light hoppy bitter ending. Very drinkable
Bottle. Pours hazy golden with low head. Aroma is pine, hops, grass, resin. Taste is malty, grassy, malty. Great stuff for the alcohol content.
Hazy yellow beer. Aromas of grass and pine hops. A crisp taste with citrus and pine hops. The low ABV does make it a bit thin both in body and finish, but pretty good.
33cl bottle. Pours hazy and golden with medium sized head. Good carbonation for the abv. Aroma of citrus, floral and lemon hops. Medium sweetness and bitterness. Good low abv beer.
Snabbrecension. Pigg, humlebetonad alkoholfri öl. Mycket apelsinskal och citrus. Trevlig.

33cl bottle. Pale golden color with a thin white head 
Citrusy, lemony hoppy aroma. Citrus juice, fruity, slightly sweet. Excellent low alco beer, refreshing.

33 cl, bottled. Pours hazy straw with a good white head. Aroma: Sweat, carrots and vegetables. Taste: Quite sweet, carrots. Xylitol. Vegetables. Palate: Medium body, sweetish aftertaste. Not bad, reminds bit vegetable drink.

Bottle. Hazy hay yellow liquid with medium off-white head. Aroma of citrus, tangerine, mango, grain and bread. Taste is dry and light bitter with notes of mango, citrus, tangerine and light wort. Light bodied with medium carbonation. Fantastic for the ABV.
Bottle. Golden with one finger head. Light body with grassy, grainy nature. Very dry with mild hop bitterness. For the style, not bad, but otherwise, not impressive at all.

Flaska från SB. Rejält disig, gyllengul vätska med högt vitt skum som lämnae en hel del rester. En välblanserad och komplett lågalkohol-APA. Frisk, ganska söt, fruktig humle med aprikospure, persika, citrus och nektar i smakbilden. Lätt beska. Ett öl som passar bra i värmen och nog funkar bra för ölskeptiker. Riktigt gott och läskande.

Theres a hoppy citrus aroma with tones of grass. It pours light golden and hazy with a lovely white head. Very light taste, bitter and balanced. Feels quite thin as you would expect, medium carbonation. Lovely fresh beer to drink many of in the sun.
On tap at BrewDog Leeds. Hazy yellow colour with a white head. Refreshing citrus aroma and taste. Lovely light beer with a bitter taste.

aroma of hop boiling. hazy yellow liquid with frothy white head. taste is like mash have butted in bottle without fermenting process. medium sweet, light bitter, light+ sour. light body, creamy, average carbonation,

Bottle, 33cl. Cloudy straw yellow color with an off-white head ½ fingers thick. Rich aroma. Hops, tropical fruits, peaches, grapes, citrus. Wheat, yeast and malts as well. Flavour is somewhat thinner, but still really enjoyable. Fruity and hoppy with nice malt sweetness underneath. Oily texture, light-medium body and soft carbonation. One of the best low-alc Ive had.
pale, golden, hazy, white foam, herbs, grass, resin, floral, medium body, sticky, average carbonation, bitter, medium sweetness, very bitter,

Hazy yellow colour, big white head. Aroma of wheat, citrus, malt, hops, a bit soapy. Dry lightly sweet taste with medium hoppy bitterness in finish and aftertaste. Thin body and average carbonation. Quite drinkable.

Heller hopfiger Beginn, der schnell trocken getreidig bitter wird. Der hopfige Part wird durch die süßliche Brotigkeit geschwächt, das Bier ist dennoch vergleichsweise süffig. Würzig, zum Ende zu bitter, angesichts des Alkoholgehalts aber gut. 11/10/7/8/10/10

Pours a hazy straw pale yellow color, topped with a big fluffy white head, soapy character. Nice and sweet fruity aroma. Tropical fruits with some citrusy presence - lots of fruit in tehre. Body is bland and a bit watery. Mild fruitiness with grainy malt and some extra gentle bitterness which is hardly felt. Not bad for a low alco. a hint of spices in teh finish. Taste doesnt blow you away, pretty average, but the aroma is superb.
@ Havregatan 151127. Bottle (330 ml) from Systembolaget. Fruity and hoppy with citrusy and light caramely notes, medium body with a watery to oily texture. The finish is dry, bitter and hoppy.

Flaske 330ml fra Systembolaget Luleå - Storheden. Drukket på Bergstua 7 Jul 15. Gusjegulbrun. Uklar. Lavt kremaktig skum med litt filigranser. God fruktaroma. Fersken. Smaken svakt søtlig frukt med innslag av grapefrukt. Malt lurer i bakgrunnen. Veldig bra ut fra styrken.

33cl courtesy of and shared with Tderoeck.
Dorée, col blanc.
Arôme au bouquet fruité et houblonné, rappelant plus une limonade, rétro de moût.
Palais est léger, moyennement pétillant avec un profil grains marqué de moût le tout est agréable léger avec un ajout fruité houblonné léger citronné tirant plus sur une bière de table houblonné.
Bottle at home from drinkshop.sk. Pours hazy golden color, white head. Aroma is hoppy, grapefruit, citrusy. Taste is bitter, grapefruit, malty. Nice hoppy finish.
Pale yellow opaque color with a thin foam layer. Smells like wet malt. The taste is aggressive harsh and tart, as well as bitter acidic and overcarbonated with some malt. Dry aftertaste.
Bottle, courtesy of SinH4. Some citric aroma, but mostly butter. Not a lot of aroma either, but I?ve had worse.
Very hazy orange color with white head. Lots of hops, but with it comes cat piss and butter bread. Taste is light, hoppy, refreshing finish. Hm. I guess its okay.

Opaque golden (6 EBC), pillowy off white head. Herbal, dank grass, light earthy some faint caramel notes with a hunch of diluted orange juice. Finely carbonated, thin elegant texture and light bodied. Light herbal sweetness with a pronounced orange zest/citrussy hop bitterness. Well balanced with a finish which has a certain momentum. Good conceptualised and quaffable.
Bottle at cerveteca lisboa, Portugal. Clear gold color. Thin white head. Medium bitterness. Herby, hoppy, light fruit aroma.
Unclear yellow with a nice, white head and complete lacing. Aroma of orange. Taste grapefruit, caramell and fruit. Long bitter aftertaste.
Bottle. Strange sweet yeast notes. Otherwise fresh and citrusy. A good beer in its category.
Quite okay, if you like hop tea - for me, the herbal/stale tea vibes were a bit of a turn-off. Otherwise, well done. Didnt feel that thin to me. Low bitterness.

Bottle at home. Aroma of grapefruit, zesty citrus, peach, hops. Flavour is light sweet and medium bitter. Body is a bit thin and watery. Surprisingly potent aroma and flavour. One of the better non-alcohol beers Ive had.
Pours hazy pale yellow with medium head. Medium carbonation and very good for non alcoholic.
Bottle, 33 cl, The Queens Head, Stockholm. A decent low-alcohol, refreshing and reminding a beer.

330 ml bottle. BB 18/06/16. Thanks Jere!
Very tasty and rich hoppy aroma and flavor. One of the most flavorful n/a beers. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Lys brun med hvitt luftig skum. Lukter veldig som vørterøl. Mildt sødme i smak. Søtlig avslutning. Ok alkoholfri.
Lys brun klar med fingerhøyt hvitt skum. Lukter papp, vanilje og moden frukt. Skarp bitterhet i smak, druesten og appelsinskall, noe karamell og brunt sukker. Medium lengde.
Botellín de 33 cl. Sencillamente brillante, espectacular, sabrosa, fresca... Sencillamente Mikkeller!!

Flaska från SB. Oklar guldfärgad, stort vitt skum. Dofter av frukt, örter och blomster. Smakinslag av persika, blomster, citrus och gräs. Medelbeska. Något tunn av förklarliga skäl, men ett riktigt trevligt hantverk.

29/VI/15 - 33cl bottle from De Caigny (Essen) @ home - BB: 12/III/16 (2015-825)  Thanks to Beerlover_Ben for getting me the bottle!
Little cloudy beige to yellow beer, big creamy off-white head, pretty stable, adhesive, leaving a nice lacing in the glass. Aroma: honey, oxidized, malty, grains, cow fodder, more honey. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: sweet start, honey, pretty bitter, hoppy, some citrus. Aftertaste: bitter, malty sweetness, lots of honey, oxidized, metallic touch. How old is this bottle? I only got it 4 months ago, but it seems its already 2 years old. A shame!

Keg at Shpit Fire. Golden with thick white head that doesnt budge. Sharp aroma, grapefruit, peach and apricot. Taste is full on peach and apricot with a little grapefruit. Not as watery as I was expecting, medium body and very refreshing

33 cl bottle from Systembolaget. Hazy, golden colour with a dense, white head. Fruity aroma with citrus fruits, wheat malts, grasses and pale malts. Taste is bitter. Light body with a thin texture and a lively carbonation. Finishes dry and bitter with citrus fruits. Lovely Low Alcohol beer.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

330ml bottle from Systembolaget. Hazy pale golden, white fluffy head. Fresh citrus aromas, peach, orange. Mild carbonation, light/medium body. Very fresh and fresh citrus flavor. Sweet citrus, tangerine, orange. Mild short bitter ending. Pretty nice!
Bottle. Yellow hazy creamy white head. Smell of citrus hops, quite zesty, grapefruit, light malts. Light sweet very dry, zesty, some cat pee. Medium bitter finish
330ml bottle. Small tan frothy head. Hazy yellow body. Aroma is wort, tropical fruits and lemon zest. Mostly bitter on the tongue. Weak body.

Served on tap at Brewdog Birmingham in a pint glass. Pours a hazy straw colour with a thick white head. Aroma is lemony, tropical fruity notes with maybe some sweet peachy notes. A hint of bitterness in the finish and a very acceptable mouthfeel for the ABV. In fact if I was the designated driver I would not be at all disappointed if they had this on tap. I have had much worse beers at 5/6%.

UPDATED: MAY 21, 2015 Bottle at Urban House.  Hazy orange color with small white head. Light hoppy aroma with malt. Strong citrus hoppy bitter taste with solid malty backbone. Long hoppy finish. Very good.
la plus merveilleuse "low alcool" jamais bue. même comparée à une bière normal elle est génial. Jai envie den boire 3L cul sec!!!
Cloudy orange color, white head. Citrus nose, wort, caramel, light malty, hint of tropical fruit. Sweet taste, citrus, wort, light bitterness. Light body, soft carbonation.

Keg, Brewdog, Leicester. Hazy orange gold with a white foam. Aromas are mellow lemon with oranges and grapefruit. Floral, sudsy pine with yeast. Biscuity cereal grain with minerals. Flavours are soapy detergent with pithy grapefruit and crisp lemon and mellow oranges. Yeasty and clean with cereal grain. Minerally dry body with a soda water finish. Good example of a low alcohol beer.

330ml bottle, kindly shared by djoeye. Hazy pale golden body. Firm white head, lacing rings down the glass. Citrus nose, mid-dry. Earthy malts and fruit hoppy taste with a touch of citrus shells to the ending. Easy to drink. Amazing tasty for a low alcohol beer even though it gives a rather watered mouthfeel (Tromsø 16.03.2015)

White head with bubble structure, clear golden body. Aroma; hops, sweet lemon candies, fresh malts. 
Taste; hops, pine, resin, lemon, candiced orange peels. Good feel. Fresh clean moreish good.
[33cl br.btl abv0.3% [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Storheden BB22/08/15 [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */]

Pours murky golden with low white head
Aromas of citrusy fruits, cardboards, bread, yeast, herbs
Taste has distinct hoppyness, herbs, cardboard, ok maltyness

Big beige head. Hazy dark brown body with lots of big floaties
and carbonation. Caramelly banana candy aroma with vegetal
notes. Dry-sweet roasty grainy taste with earthy notes and
something faintly putrid. Mid-bodied. Mild, soft mouthfeel.
Dry-sweet minty grainy earthy aftertaste with overripe banana
notes. Leaves small particles in the mouth. (0.33l bottle, I
forget where from.)

33cl bottle at Fermentoren Aarhus. Pours a clear yellow with a soapy white, long lasting head. Aroma has lots of hoppy citrus like orange, mandarin, little bit of soap and some plain malty sweetness. Taste is fine for what it is. Pretty high hop bitterness, sweeter pale, plain malts. If this were colder it would do pretty well for a low alcohol beer. Still not comparable with alcoholic intoxicating beers. High carb and gentle body.
Hazy orange with a massive thick white slowly dissipating foam, nice. Aroma of citrus, hay, wheat/grains. Taste citrus, grape, grassy, slight soapy bitter finish. Light body, medium carbo.

Flaska systembolaget. Grumlig orange vätska med ett ganska tjockt fint vitt skum. Fuktig doft som påminner om fruktpuré/smothie på äpple och banan. Även i smak får jag en känsla av puré. Blött bröd därtill Rejäl bitterhet och beska.

How: Bottle.
Appearance: Hazy golden color, creamy medium head.
Aroma: Citrus, hops, hay
Palate: Light body,lively carbonation, bitter finish.

33cl bottle from Systembolaget, Strömstad. Pours hazy golden with a white. Fairly fruity and hoppy aroma with wheaty notes, bananas, canned peach, citrus and hints of pine. Moderate sweet with fruity and hoppy flavours and a pretty noticeable bitterness. Flavourful, a bit thin and watery, but certainly decent for its strenght.
Bottle. Hazy amber pour with small white head. Aroma had fruit and citrus Taste is fresh and bitter. Not bad for a low ABV beer

Bottle from Rehills, Newcastle. Pale hazy straw coloured with a delicate floral and sweet citrus fruity flavour, a slight thin body (but not overly so) followed by a sugary sweet and bitter pine finish. Absolutely superb for what in effect is a non-alcoholic beer!

On bottle from Systembolaget Strømstad. Golden hazy color, ok foam. Aromas of hops, citrus, wheat, orange, some grassy notes; medium aroma intensity. Medium/light body & medium complexity. Solid bitterness. Pretty ok, but miss some backbone on this one
Mycket humle, men ingen vidare klangbotten. Funkar absolut, men inget första hands alternativ.

Klar lys gyllen farve med lyst skum. Lukt av malt, grapefrukt og humle. Smak av malt, grapefrukt, sitrus og humle. Fruktig og noe bitter avslutning. 
Import.

Lukt: Søtlig duft av hvete.
Utseende: Dunkel gul farge.
Skum/kullsyre: Tynt lag hvitt skum.>
Smak: Smak av hvete og vørter.

Medium: [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */
33cl bottle and you can feel the De Proefbrouwerij and Mikkeller alot! Super low alc. beer. Has everything you would expect from wheat ale. Lacks alcohol.

05.05.2014, 0,33l bottle @ home:
Big creamy longlasting head. Aroma is fresh citrusy, wheat, citrus peel, yeast, fresh hops, hay, leafs, flowers, grass, caramel, citrus, worht. Taste is slightly sweet grassy, lawn, worht, citrus peel, hops, leafs, pine needles, caramel, wheat, yeast. Medium bitterness, slightly dry grassy mouthfeel. Very nice for being only 0,3% ABV, and not killed by hops like most low alcohol beers usually are....

Bottle from Mikkeller Webshop.
Orange, hazy body, with a medium, creamy, stable, white head.
Moderate, but juicy aroma of citrus and many tropical fruits.
Taste is quite thin of course, but surprisingly satisfying at the same time, with the same fruits, also bitter grapefruit, grass, some pine, slight biscuit.
Mouthfeel is light, slick, with a lively carbonation and it finishes bitter, dry, citric and grassy.

Clearly the best alcohol free beer Ive ever had! The taste is a bit thin of course, but far from other alcohol free beers and still crisp, very fruity, pleasantly bitter and extremely refreshing! Im suprised how much I enjoyed this compared to the quite low ratings, an alcohol free couldnt be much better in my opinion!

BOTTLE 33 CL from ivodoni1.

Look:hazy yellow, white creamy head.
Aroma: citrus and caramel, honey, some sweet baking spice.
Taste: its got some of that non-alcoholic feel to it - a bit of unfermented wort and thin body, malt sweetness, hops, strong inky bitter finish.

Inte alls god. En konstig bismak som förstör upplevelsen.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours hazy bright yellow with two finger head. Nose is earthy and piney hops. Also some familiar "low-ABV maltiness". Taste is incredibly bitter with grassy hops. It makes a good job masking the unpleasant "unfinished beer taste" so common in this types of beers. Very thin body, medium carbonation. Still, must be the best nonalcoholic if had to this date.

Cloudy yellow color with a fine white head. Ok lacing. Looks really nice. Fresh grapefruit hoppy, herbal, some wort and fruity aroma. Outstanding for an non alcoholic beer. Medium light body. Moderate sweet and a fine bitterness. Quite fresh grapefruit hoppy, mild fruity, herbal and some wort in the flavor. One of the best non alcoholic beer I have tasted.[Bottle from Systembolaget web order, Sweden]

A retrospective review based on occasions Ive had this at different bars. 

For a non-alcoholic beer (and as such it should be judged) this is very good - be it from a glass or straight from the bottle. Its fruity, perfumey, citrusy, grapefruity, piney, grassy - aroma and taste are both quite strong and more sweet (maybe even overtly so) than bitter, its got a light body and medium carbonation, only slightly watery palate. It is admittedly better when cold.

Appropriate for those occasions when youve already had a few strong ones, and feel absolutely great, but fear that the next 7-10% ABV beer would make you look and sound like Droopy.

33 cl bottle @ home. 
Aroma of floral and fresh hops. 
Pours hazy golden amber with frothy white head. Virtually no head lasting. Moderate bitterness, little dry and sour. Finish is dry, light body, watery texture, lively carbonation.

Bottle 33 cl.
Foggy yellow, with white head. Fruity aroma with lots of hops. Cereal and hoppy bitterness. And long dry finish.
Fra flaske på Cardinal, M2 sep-14: lukter kokt kålrabi, kompost og Zalo. Ingen maltkropp til å bære den voldsomme bitterheten - direkte ubalansert.
Shared bottle at Cardinal, Stavanger. Pours yellow, cloudy. Aroma of tropical fruits, grassy. Thin bodied, distinct bitter finish.
Very psle and hazy yellow. Awful aroma of various boiled vegetables. Swedes, broccolli etc. Also herbs and tropical fruits. Lots of hop juice in taste. Terribly unbalanced.
Shared bottle at Cardinal. Pours unclear pale golden with a tiny white head. Aroma is hoppy, very hoppy. Taste is very dry, bitter, harsh and unbalanced. Will not try again.
Shared bottle at Cardinal.misty golden body with a dense light brown head. Grass compost on the nose. Paper, wort and hop extract flavor. Watery texture, light bodied. Dry tongue.

330 ml bottle, Cardinal Pub & Bar, Stavanger. ABV is 0.3%. Malts are pale, wheat and cara-red, hops are Amarillo og Tettnanger. Cloudy straw colour, moderate white head. Aroma of wheat wort, citrus and some spice. The flavour is first citrussy, mild and refreshing, then a sharp and nearly medicinal bitterness takes over. Very bitter aftertaste.
Bottle. Golden colour with a white head. Aroma is wort, malt, hop.Flavour is wort, malt, hop, grain. Thin body. Bad beer.

Bottle, 0.3%. Slightly hazy yellow with big white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, hop, citrus, orange and a little grainy. Flavour is malt, fruit, hop, thin, citrus, little pine, little peach, little sweet and medium bitter.

Keg at BD ShepBush. Hazy gold with nicely lasting white head. Sweet grainy aroma, citrus and crisp hops. Sweet almost corn-like grain taste, moderate bitter, zesty, dry. Thin, decent finish. I really hate it when people complain about low abv beers being thin or not having the intensity of flavour they expect from a regular brew. Jeez - I think for what it is this is great, though I admit Id only drink it as a designated driver really.

Low ABVs have to be looked on for what they are. This one needs to be drinked really cold, just a warning. The taste is upfront grapefruit, with a rather hollow body. The aftertaste is almost sugar-sweetened and the warmer it gets, the more awkward I feel.
UPDATED: OCT 15, 2014 Deep marmelade aroma. Orange fruit taste with grape fruit finish. Light but tasty.
UPDATED: NOV 30, 2014 Because its non-alcoholic, I think its perfect. And it even stands up against many strong beers.
Minimal fruity flavor and aroma. Incredibly bitter but still unpalatable. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.

Bottle 0,33l. Pours a hazy orange body, medium white head. Aroma is herbs, nettles, peaches, hints of grass and apricot. Taste is grass, peaches, bitter herbal notes and hints of wort and grapefruit. Light body, medium carbonation. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Very good wit with low alcohol content, one of the best I have tried. Fresh and still tasteful.
Ganska ljus, något grumlig. Bra skum som ligger kvar en stund. Väldigt besk men ändå viss sötma och fruktighet. Mycket eftersmak. Släcker törsten bra! Normalt kolsyrad

Bottle at S&G tasting.
APPEARANCE: clouded blond beer, small unstable white head.
NOSE: wheat, fresh, fruity.
TASTE: wheat, light, bitter.

330 ml bottle. Unclear yellow/orange with a white head. Nice aroma of citric fruit and grass. Light and refreshing in flavor, just like expected from aroma. Not much malt, but refreshing fruit and quite bitter. Actually a bit sweet as well. Medium to light body, decent for the alcohol strength, refreshing bitter aftertaste. Nice low alcohol beer.

Bottle bought @ Hemköp Majorna. Pours milky reddish golden with a frothy white head that slowly dissipates while leaving some spotty trace on the glass. Smell is slightly malty and fruity with wheat flour, crackers, grapefruit juice, mango, pineapple, hay, pine needles, dry soil and hints of cloves and coriander. Taste is bitter, malty and tiny fruity with wheat flour, unfermented wort, grapefruit rinds, orange peal, moist grass, pine needles and hints of green bell peppers. Mouthfeel is soft, grainy, astringent, watery and light bodied. Finish is bitter with unfermented wort, grapefruit rinds, moist grass, pine needles and green bell peppers. Ferment it perhaps?
Oh my God! Is this really alcohol free? The taste is full of bitter hop flavors and the wheat malt creates a fresh brew for hot summer days.
Flaska från Systembolaget delad med @msbrindbergs på stranden... Dricker ur flaskan men den ser bra ut. Söt doft, honung. Härlig amarillobeska. God lättis

Flaska delad med MrHult på stranden, man tackar!
Drucken ur flaskan. 
Doftar jättefint av amarillon, tropisk frukt och gran. 
En lätt sötma och stor beska. 
Jättebra alkoholfri!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Botella de 33 cl de el rincón de la cerveza 17-07-2014. (R,,94) Color ámbar anaranjado turbio con buena capa de espuma blanca. Aromas suaves maltas y lúpulos muy suavizados. Cuerpo ligero con 0.3 vol y paso por boca cremoso y suave. Sabores de cereales y maltas con un ligero lúpulo con también ligero amargo final. De las mejores sin alcohol, sino la mejor hasta la fecha. Bastante refrescante y para bebersela de dos tragos. Para repetir

Bottle. Hazy orange body, medium white head. Nose is herbs, nettles, peaches, hints of grass and apricot. Taste is grass, peaches, bitter herbal notes and hints of wort and grapefruit. Light body, medium carbonation. Pleasant low alcohol pale ale from Mikkeller.

Bottle from SB cons 2014-07-21 Karlskoga
AR: citrus, apricot jam, melas
AP: hazy orange, high frothy/fizzy head
F: fizzy, apricot, melas, bread, citrus great aroma not the best aroma
Ljusgul grumlig med mellanstort ljust skum. Doftar friskt av humlen och smakar mycket humle! Fyllig och mycket smak trots 0.3%

Bottle, 0.3%. Nice grapefruity hop aroma. Cloudy yellow colour. Good stable white head. The flavour starts off with a good grapefruity hop flavour, turning quite bready and finishing with a sweetish malt note. Tastes good, but has the usual non-alcohol finish.
Pours hazy orange. Fluffy, white head. Hoppy, citric aroma. Citric bitterness, lemons.

Bottle from Systembolaget @ home.
Unclear bright yellow with a 3 finger bubbly soapy white head that lace.
Sweet fruity hoppy aroma with green grapes, mandarins, pineapple, canned pear and whipped cream. Whipped cream and canned fruits? Well, why not.
Sweet tropic fruity with canned tropical fruits and grapefruit. Pleasant zesty bitterness at first, but it gets a bit inky and perfumy in the aftertaste. The sweetness helps giving the flavour some body, but it also gets a bit annoying in the aftertaste and feels a bit like saccharine.
Light to medium bodied, soft carbonation, soft texture.
A refreshing hoppy "alcohol free" beer as long as you drink it fast and dont let the inky/saccharine aftertaste hit you.
Alltså för att vara 0,3 så är den ofantligt bra! Man få ju sätta det i perspektiv men väldigt väldigt välhumlad arom och smak, även kroppen är lite fyllig.

Bottled, from Systembolaget.  Murky golden, rich head. Perfumy peach aroma. Dry and thin with clean mouthfeel and thin body. Aggressive inky bitterness. Sharp metal joins the disharmony. Very low drinkability.
Bottle 33 cl from Systembolaget. Hazy orange with a thick white head. Peaches, some bitterness, wormwood, vegetables?, mushrooms? Medium body, medium carbonation, bitter finish.

Dimmig, ljus orange med ett vitt skum. Doft: Rå humle doft, vört, asfalt. Enkelt sagt den luktar som en väl humlad öl innan jäsning. Smak: Som att ha botten sattsen i munnen efter humle koket. Brukar kalla det humle te :)

Bottle from systembolaget. Smells sweet with some hops and a strong smell of fruits. Pours hazy orange with a medium white head. Taste is a bit bland but still impressive for a low alcohol beer. Palate is as expected but still not bad. Overall a good alternative if you dont wish for a alcoholic beer.

33cl bottle from Appellation Wines.
Appearance -cloudy golden orange with some decent lacing. 
Nose - papaya and rose water
Taste - some passionfruit but then into dry grapefruity through to the finish. 
Palate - light to medium bodied with a creamy texture and a decent long dry finish.
Overall - it tastes like a real beer which is the most important thing! Great job!

Bottle at Barely Legal Tasting Room . 
Pours fuzzy yellow, small white head . 
Smell is bitter, but with a harsh, not-working-fruityness to it . 
Taste is bitter, the fruityness works better than it did in the smell . way better . Stonefruits, in a delicate yet intense way . Bitter up front untill the fruit takes over . 
Quite alright .

Appearance: A hazy amber colored beer. A off-white head with good lacing and small curtains.Palate: Medium high carbonation, a coarse texture. A small body with a dry finish.Overall: Wort with loads of hop. Not very pleasant.Note: Bottle 330 ml at home. Reviewed 2014-07-13.

How: Bottle.
Where: Urban Deli Nytorget, Stockholm
Appearance: Hazy light golden colour with a white head.
Aroma: Grass, grapefruit, floral.
Body: Light body, medium carbonation.
Flavour: Hops, hay, caramel, citrus.
Keg at brewdog Edinburgh... Light hazy yellow... Thin white lacing... Zezty passion fruit nose... Herbal.. Zezty peachy fruit nose... Something im not liking
Hazy lemon with fair white head. Aroma hops, citrus, yeast. Sustained carbonation. Beautifully balanced.
Bottle from the Mikkeller Store. A Load of citruss smell. Hops and lime. Grass and floral

Aroma: 
citrus, herbs, hay, dough, bread
Appearance: 
hazy, golden, pale, white foam, 
quite high bitterness in the style of brewdogs Nanny State but i think they could have put in more hops. You got to compensate. 

medium body, thin feel, soft carbonation, 
bitter, 

Im not that impressed actually. I guess my standard is a bit to high after brewdogs nanny state release. I think this could have come more hoppy

Hazy golden with a white head - Good aroma of citrus and tropical fruits - A littel bit thin in the body, but there are some good flavours from hops that are citrus and tropical flowers with some bitternes - The finish is a lot of hops with some bitterness that is olmost dry and ends with grapefruits - This was nice despite the thin body

Flaska från systembolaget. Spännande smak av pepprig rotfrukt och inte alls så tunn som alkoholfria öl annars lätt blir men ser rätt dassig ut och rotfruktigheten är inte vad jag söker i en öl. Möjligen tycker jag bara inte om öltypen?

Tall white fluffy head. Cloudy, pale, dark golden color. Some strange aroma. Root vegetable? Bitter, rough and thin. Some sweetness in the taste. It get some extra overall points be course of the low abv.
Bottle. Golden pour with white head. Grassy and floral hop aromas. Flavors are pretty full for non alcoholic.

Hazy orange with big white head. Aroma: smells of fresh hops, fruity, pine, light. Taste: juicy hops, nice level of bitterness, very refreshing. Surprisingly thick body for a 0.3 beer. Positively surprised by this. Good alcohol free alternative!

Keg at the Brewdog AGM 2014. Aroma is spicy hop, some eggs Benedict, pine needles. Translucent golden coloured pour with a lasting sticky white head. Flavour is crisp light citrus, wheat grains. Light bitterness. Light palate somewhat watery but impressive for the abv. Grainy on the tongue and a dry finish. Solid for the abv. Really impressive.

Keg at Brewdog aka Queuedog AGM, AECC Aberdeen, 21/06/14.
Hazed golden orange with a moderate off white covering that retains well.
Nose is light florals, peach, tangerine, faint tropicana, mango.
Taste comprises light pine, perfumed tones, mandarin, mango, orange pith, melon.
Light to medium bodied, not overly thin, fine carbonation, semi drying close laced with grassy hop bitterness.
Amazing flavour profile for the ABV!
Could happily sink a gallon of this on a summers day ... then drive home!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Great flavour for such a low abv, great at recessing the palate after a few hours at brewdog AGM

Keg at BD AGM. It pours hazy golden with a thick white head. The nose is grapefruit, orange peel, perfumed, sherbet and orange chewits. The taste is smooth, bitter, pine needles, citrus peel, soap, dough and pepper with a dry finish. Light body and fine carbonation. Great stuff for next to zero alcohol.

Bottle @ home 20140619. Impressive head retention. Hop juice! Aroma has loads of pineapple, passionfruit, mango and citrus, a little murky. Taste is similar with tons of tropical fruits, tea, a little murky with a nice bitterness. Leaves a strange aftertaste of cigarettes (!?) No malt backbone whatsoever. Reminds me more of tea than beer. Still better than most normal wort-tasting alcohol free beers.

UPDATED: DEC 4, 2016 0,33L bottle. Pours cloudy golden with white head. The head stays. Aroma is malt, herbal, spices, and some salt. Taste is malt, herbal, grass, some caramel, and salt. Finish is grapefruit bitter. Overall: reminds me dill pickles for some reason (maybe because of the herbal notes?!). Watery notes are well hidden, but wouldnt drink this again.

World Cup Tasting. Cloudy golden with a lasting white head. The aroma has tea, grainy malt and a touch of citrus. Quite sweet, but thin and watery flavour, with a touch of citrus and a rather bitter finish
VM Tasting @ Christian. Pours hazy golden with a white head. Grapefruit, peach and grass. A bit thin perhaps but dry, crisp and tasty. Something I would actually drink at 0,3%.
Bottle @ Carlsens kvarter. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are grain, hops, malt, flowers and has a pleasant bitter finish.
330ml bottle. Golden body with a low white head. Hay, sweet malt and quite a refreshing hop presence for such a low ABV beer.

Lightly hazy pale golden colour, white head. Aroma of hay, straw, pine, hops. Quite harsh bitter flavour, straw, bitter meadow herbs. Quite thin. Harsh bitter finish. Rather nice, but too thin and unbalanced bitter to be really very drinkable.(from 33cL bottle @ home)

Pours hazy orange with low white head. Aroma of tropical fruit, light rye bread, citrus, distinct funky hops. Taste is hoppy, very hoppy, medium bitter with light sweetness and hoppy bitter finish. Light, smooth body with soft carbonation.
Blindprivning gentemot 1,3 % varianten. Måste betygsätta då Faan va såå blommig å juvliga Amarillo dofter . Smakade makalöst för så lite alkohol. Alla som provade lovordade denna variant .
330 ml bottle. Hazy yellow with white head. Smell is sweet malty and floral hops. Taste is very sweet, creamy and very soapy. Some hops is there. I could not finish this one. (Maybe a bad bottle?)

33cl Bottle from De Bierkoning, enjoyed straight from the bottle in the park. Aroma is nice and hoppy, lots of grapefruit, citrus, hint of wheat, sweet malts. Flavour is quite sugary and sweet, orange peel, grapefruit, citrus, pine, nice bitter finish. Its tasty, light-bodied but not thin, but just a bit too sweet to be really refreshing. Good effort though.

Bottle. It pours a dense, finger-thick white head over a hazy golden body. Mostly malty aroma, with a wort like touch and some pine cones. Too much wort. The flavor has a fine citrusy, piney hoppyness, but again theres too much wort-like maltyness. Medium to thin on the palate, with a pleasant carbonation level. Wort-like finish with not enough hoppyness. Might be a bit old though. 140509
Bottle. Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma of floral hops, malt and bread. Flavor is sweet and somewhat floral with some citrus and caramel.Medium body, average carbonation.

Bottle 330ml @ Geokkjer
Pours hazy golden with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, wort and hint of citrus. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter with a long wort and caramel finish. Body is light, texture is thin, carbonation is soft.

UPDATED: JUL 2, 2014 33 cl bottle (0,3%) @ hotel room, Copenhagen 
Aroma is a total gooseberry bush overdose, some grapefruit and nettles. Also some boilde cabbage. Feels farty. Flavour has hops, some plastic tones and gooseberries. Also some grapefruit-like tones. Perhaps past its prime, but definitely not bad for (almost) alcoholfree beer.

330 ml bottle. Pours a golden colour with a small head. Aroma of grains, herbs and some earthiness. Flavour of grains, raw kale, floral hops, some mild fruitiness and earth. Light bodied and slick mouthfeel. Thin and a bit weird. The other versions of Drinkin the Sun are much better.

33 cl bottle @ hotel room, Copenhagen.
Pours hazy pale golden color with a small head. Aroma of hay, herbs, floral hops and gooseberry bush. Flavor of hay, hops, mandarin, some vegetable-like notes here, nettle and grass. Very light but somewhat decent.
2313

330ml bottle

Pours clear yellowish orange with a small head. Aroma of juicy hops, orange peel, citrus and mild maltiness. Taste is smooth, juicy and watery with hints of orange peel, herbal notes and vegetables. Finish is watery, juicy and mildly hoppy. Not quite as good as the other ones in the series.

Hard to place hop aroma, a bit vegetabilic. Hazy golden colour, white head. Same hard to place taste as I found in the aroma, good bitterness. Light body, average carbonation dry texture. Drinkin in the snow is much better

Bottled from Ica Åkered
Hazy golden with a white head. 
Fruity resinous aroma with some mashy notes. 
Medium to high bitterness. 
Rein and tropical fruits, mango, in the flavour. 
Surprisingly complex with a medium body.

Aroma is fruits and citrus. Hazy Yellow With great head. Taste is heavy bitterness With Some wheat softness on the palate. In the overall the abv Had an effect, This Taste and no alcohol meant i enjoyed drinking This more Than 99% of the beers ive tried So it deserves it.

0,33l bottle @ Mikkeller & Friends. Pours hazy yellow with a high head. Aroma is very fruity, mostly peach and citrus, with some hops. Flavor is malts with plenty of fruits and hops. Watery but not too much so. Probably the best non-alcoholic beer Ive tried.

Aroma: light to medium floral hops. Appearance: hazy pale gold, small creamy white head. Taste: medium bitter. Palate: bitters continue, get a bit dry in the quite long finish. Overall: wow, great taste for such a low ABV beer. Pint at Mikkeller & Friends, Copenhagen.

Pours in dark amber body with low white head. Aroma is hay, bready, very grainy, coriander, mineraly. Taste is very low hay grainy sweetness, harsh grassy herby bitterness. Very grainy, but not so sweet anyway. Body is medium with medium carbonation, watery.

Ljust bärnstensfärgad med vitt skum Lätt dimmig. Doft av gräs, hö, lätt jästighet. En ganska gräsig humlekaraktär. Ganska mycket humle utan att det blir ren humlejuice. Tunn kropp men ändå den klart bästa nära noll % öl jag druckit.

Tap @ Bishops Arms, Gustav Adolfs Torg, Malmö. Unclear dark yellow with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, yeasty and moderate hoppy - citrus. Flavor is medium sweet and light bitter. Sweet and light bitter finish. Watery. 080214

Tap at the Bishops Arms (Gustavs Adolfs Torg), Malmo. Poured a hazy light amber with a huge frothy white head. The aroma is pretty weak and nondescript but its more herb veggie than anything else. The flavour is very weak bitter with a watery spice herb veggie palate. Medium to light bodied with average carbonation. There really isnt much at all to this beer. No body and little in the way of any decent flavour. There are some good low alcohol beers floating around but sadly this is not one of them.

Bottle 33 cl. Pours a hazy golden with a small, white head. Sweet wort aroma and some citrusy hops. Light body, rather sweet mashy character and some sweaty, greasy aroma hops. Ends quite bitter. 271213

From Voldby, DK.
Bottled, 201113.
Golden with white head. Aroma of malt and citrus. Flavor with spices and sweetness
Bottle. Tropical fruit, light toffee, dry and bitter, surprising amount of flavour for such low abv.
Bottle. Hazy golden with a white foamy head. Aroma is citrus, wheat, grass, lemon. Fruity taste with slight bitterness. Soapy mouthfeel.

33cl bottle. It pours a slightly hazy yellow orange body with a medium white head. Sweet nose, fruits, hops, malts, somemedicinal note. Taste is fruity, malts, more emdicinal notes. Not sure whats wrong with these beer but it kinda taste like malt extract and medicines. Not my cup of tea.

Bottle 330ml.ABV: 0.3%. Unclear matt medium yellow colour with a average to large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white head. Aroma is light to moderate malty, wheat, pale malt, moderate to light heavy hoppy, citrus, grass, grapefruit, light minerals. Flavour is moderate to light heavy sweet and light bitter with a average to long duration, sweet malt, fruity, citrus notes. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20130917]

Bottle from BrewDog. Fully hazed witbier yellow with a fine pile of suds. Lemon cake, grass and parsley aroma. Soapy and floral with generous bitterness; lemon meringue hints, crackers. Empty finish but its excusable. Suggestions of lemon drops, toothpaste and menthol. Some earthy background yeast. Funny tasting flat lemonade.

Bottled 330ml from Drink Shop
Hazy orange color, small white head. Plasticky grass aroma. Light bodied, watery. Grassy hops, some fruityness and wort notes. Decent.

Draught at Bishops Arms, Malmö, Gustav Adolf TorgHuge creamy head (too much) over muddy pale blond liquid. The aroma satisfies the hop lovers; fruity in the beginning, light pineapple; bag of hop cones later. Most carbonation is gone now, the mouthfeel is therefore soft; flavor of cereals, with light residual sweetness; bitter without exaggeration, with plenty of hop oils.One of the best NA.
Bottle from Mane Liquor. Drunk out of the bottle. Nose is light citric juice, orange, lime, banana and slight biscuit. Taste has focus on banana and sweet citric fruits. Not bad but nothing special
On tap @sbwf13. Hazy golden with white head. Aroma of wheat, citrus and grass. Taste is very hoppy, citrus, wheat, very bitter. Surprisingly rich taste for a nearly non-alcohol beer.

Sample at SMÖF 2013. Fresh and hoppy smell, lots of citrus some wheat bread in the background. Similar taste with a quite strong bitterness. They really managed to put allot of flavour into this one. Great considering the ABV.
Bottle courtesy of Mr_H a hazy golden ale with pleasant fruity aroma flavour is grassy with citrus and herbal notes very light and fresh great low alcohol beer

330ml bottle shared with mr_h. Hazy golden amber, reasonable head. Big tropical fruit grain & hop aroma. Resin biscuit hop flavour. Bitter aftertaste. Big tasting low alcohol beer, a bit like BrewDog Nanny State.
330ml bottle from Valhallas Goat, Glasgow - golden with a slight haze, strong citrusy grapefruit aroma, dry bitter citrus flavour and prolonged bitter aftertaste, highly carbonated

UPDATED: DEC 28, 2014 First ratingSampled draught at SB&WF 2013.Hazy golden color, white head. Hoppy, citrus, grassy scent. Hoppy, citrus, light, bitter taste. Sort of medium low to thin mouthfeel, medium but unbalanced to the wrong (high) side bitterness.I had heard great things about it before tasting it, didnt live up to my expectations. As for non alcohol/low alcohol beer a decent one, but there are others I prefer a lot more over this one. That being said, I love the idea of making a non/very low alcohol beer, just would need less bitterness and more body. Is it spring mashed at all?5/3/4/2/8=2.2Rerate33 cl bottle thanks to my brother. Sampled on December 25, 2014.Hazy golden color, fluffy lating white head. Gariny, lemon scent. Lemon, malty, grainy, bitter taste. Bitter, lemon aftertaste. Thin mouthfeel, high unbalanced bitterness.5/4/5/2/9=2.5

Bottle from NK Saluhall.
Pours hazy golden with a big White head.
Hoppy citrusy bitter aroma.
Citrusy, hint of soap. It actualy has a body, impressing for a no alco brew!

Sample at SBWF 2013.

Hazy golden with a white head. Aroma and taste of fruit, some grass, bread, caramel and some malt. The body was light. Some bitterness in the dry finish. A good Low Alcohol beer.

Gylden uklar skum hvid 
Citrus malt korn 
Bitter meget sød moderate 
Livlig vandede 
@f1

22DKK from Kihosk, 0.3%! Lovely cloudy gold with a fizzy white head. Zesty lemon aroma, with a bitter grainy lemon taste on a thin body. Better than most low ABV beers but not all that great, ok. The 1.4% version is tastier.

Bottle, bought @ Ølbutikken, Cph.
Pours hazy dark yellow woth a medium, creamy, white head. Aroma has grass, light brewing cereal, touch of cookie, mild resin and melon. Medium carbonation, rather thin and watery. Flavour has hops bitterness, resin, light metal, soft wheat sweetness. A bit of melon. A bit rough, but impressive that a non-alcoholic beer can still pack some punch. Tasted alongside the 1,4 % version.

Bottle. Hazy orange with a decent white head and ok retention. Light grassy, citrussy nose. Not as sweet, grainy or watery as aspected for the abv. Decent body with a little caramel. Light grapefruity notes. Hoppy, dry bitter greenish finish. Fab within its ABV limits!
33 cl bottle @ home. Pours cloudy golden with a white head that leaves a little lacing. Aroma is citrus, banana, and straw. Flavour is much like the aroma  with a slightly bitter finish.
Bottle @ yespr. Pours a hazy golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty weak yeasty hoppy aroma. Fruity malty hoppy bitter flavor. Has a fruity thin malty hoppy bitter finish.

Bottle at Hamnmästaren, Malmö. Hazy yellow/apricot color witha small white head. Hoppy grass aroma, herbal, floral notes, grapefruit, some mash. Hoppy grassy flavor, bort, mash notes, bready, hay, citrus, some caramel. I really wanted this beer to be better than this...

Bottle form drink shop, tallinn. Hazy light orange color, nice white head. Aroma is orange, fruits, sweetness, some hops. Medium body, fruits, sweetness, hops, some sweet fruits. Pretty nice for low alcohol.

Hazy yellowish orange. Sweet nose, fruits, hops, malts. Taste is fruity, ,juice-like, malts somewhere in there. Finish has a fair hop profile with decent bitterness. Thin texture, lively carbonation, dry mouthfeel.

Bottle. Cloudy yellow body with a tall head. Aroma has mild citric hops, some cookies and pet food. Taste is pleasantly hoppy and it doesnt let the pet food aspects dominate like they do in most non alcoholic lagers. NA lagers dont have to suck - brewers just need to add an adequate amount of hops in them.

UPDATED: JUL 16, 2014 Re-rate, several bottles, July 14. Best NA beer ever, in my opinion. Bought a case. 

Pours hazy yellow with good, long-lasting head. Smell is all citrus fruits. Taste is more of the same. Kinda like a soft drink (which, stating the obvious, it kinda is). No discernible malt characteristics, but a balanced palate - the only other similar beer Ive had is Nanny State, which is way too thin and bitter. This is more rounded. Glad I tried it.
cloudy yellow, small white head. aroma is slightly roasted malty, flowery. flavor is malty, flowery, sugar candy.

330ml bottle (shared by FatPhil, thanks). Hazy orange color. Small off-white head, stays. Hops, grapefruit, grassy, fruity notes in aroma. Sweet, caramel, grapefruit seeds in flavor. Medium bitter aftertaste.

UPDATED: JUL 5, 2016 330ml bottle (Drink Shop, Tallinn) (5:3:4:2:8=2.2)
Amazingly fruity aroma, its like fruit juice. Hazy orange, small persistent head. Very cereally body, its like someone poured fruit juice over a bowl of weetabix and cornflakes. Metallic bitter bite, copper coins. Resiny and sticky. Not an LA Id chose to drink.
Rerate: 330ml bottle (Lendav Taldrik) (5:3:5:3:11=2.7)
OK, this was an LA I chose to drink, and it was cleaner, wheatier and barley-ier, lots of citrussy hops and no flaws. Im sure this was the best on the menu - so yes, it is an LA Id chose to drink again.

Bottle at Mikkeller. Cloudy light golden - white head. Aroma of banana. Hay. Straw. Malty. Husky dusty aroma. Ok bitter taste. Grainy - rather high grainy. Light citrus. Flowery notes. Acid notes. Light wet hay. Ok full body - but need the fresh flower/citrus hop aroma and taste the 1.4% version has.
Bottled. Golden coloured. Uncelar. Dense off white head. ARoma. Herbs, tea bag, grass. Flavour: Tea bag, sweetness, light caramel, herbs. Thin bodied. Ends light bitter and bready.

Bottle at yespr.
Cloudy golden coloured with a small white head.
Fruity aroma of caramel and hops.
Fruity flavour of grass and hops.
Dry hoppy finish.

Bottled. A hazy yellow beer with a white head. The aroma has notes of straw, malt, and hops. The flavor is sweet with notes of straw, hops, and malt, leading to a dry finish. Thanks yespr for sharing.
33 cL bottle. Pours hazy yellow with a small off white head. Aroma is herbal, spiced and caramelish. Bitter, grassy and toasted malty. Bitter and dry into the finish.
